intro: Vrydagzynea angustisepala, commonly known as the narrow-lobed vrydagzynea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
